drug.name: Aloglutamol
drug.description: Aloglutamol is an antacid salt of aluminium, gluconic acid, and tris. Proprietary names include Altris, Pyreses, Tasto and Sabro.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as sugar acids and derivatives. These are compounds containing a saccharide unit which bears a carboxylic acid group.

drug-interaction.name: Bosutinib
drug-interaction.description: Aloglutamol can cause a decrease in the absorption of Bosutinib resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy.

drug-interaction.name: Cefditoren
drug-interaction.description: The serum concentration of Cefditoren can be decreased when it is combined with Aloglutamol.

drug-interaction.name: Dabigatran etexilate
drug-interaction.description: Aloglutamol can cause a decrease in the absorption of Dabigatran etexilate resulting in a reduced serum concentration and potentially a decrease in efficacy.
